title: Drawing, "Designs for Floor Lamps", 1989
medium: Graphite, color crayon on cream paper
signed: Signed in graphite, lower right margin: Sottsass '89
provenance: Ettore Sottsass; Yamagiwa Corporation; Joe Kish; Friedman Benda as of February 2013
creditline: Gift of Friedman Benda, courtesy of the artist
description: Sheet filled with designs for lamps, some standing, some hanging from the ceiling. Upper left, a rough sketch of a landscape. Encircled numbers: 16, 17, and 18.
justification: These two drawings relate to a 1989 commission from the Yamagiwa Art Foundation, Tokyo, awarded to Ettore Sottsass for lighting fixture designs.&nbsp; For the standing wall lamps, the sketch with the green color crayon and the number “16” beside it was fabricated.&nbsp; Among the wall sconce designs, the company chose to fabricate a version of the two drawings in the middle of the upper part of the sheet.&nbsp;

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Designs for Floor Lamps", 1989.Graphite, color crayon on cream paper. Gift of Friedman Benda, courtesy of the artist. 2013-24-11.
